DataElement.preferredDefinition: A yes or no response used to indicate that an adult female's menopausal status is at the time before menopause or at the time when menstrual periods become irregular as she approaches menopause.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A human who has reached reproductive age._A person who belongs to the sex that normally produces ova. The term is used to indicate biological sex distinctions, or cultural gender role distinctions, or both._Having to do with the time before menopause. Menopause ("change of life") is the time of life when a woman's menstrual periods stop permanently._Describes the time in a woman's life when menstrual periods become irregular as she approaches menopause. This is usually three to five years before menopause and is often marked by many of the symptoms of menopause, including hot flashes, mood swings, night sweats, vaginal dryness, trouble concentrating, and infertility.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A human who has reached reproductive age.:A person who belongs to the sex that normally produces ova. The term is used to indicate biological sex distinctions, or cultural gender role distinctions, or both.

Concepts.definition: An age group comprised of humans who have reached reproductive age.
A person who belongs to the sex that normally produces ova. The term is used to indicate biological sex distinctions, or cultural gender role distinctions, or both.

Property.preferredDefinition: Having to do with the time before menopause. Menopause ("change of life") is the time of life when a woman's menstrual periods stop permanently.:Describes the time in a woman's life when menstrual periods become irregular as she approaches menopause. This is usually three to five years before menopause and is often marked by many of the symptoms of menopause, including hot flashes, mood swings, night sweats, vaginal dryness, trouble concentrating, and infertility.

Concepts.definition: Describes the time in a woman's life as she approaches menopause. This is usually three to five years before menopause and is often marked by irregular menstrual periods and many of the symptoms of menopause, including hot flashes, mood swings, night sweats, vaginal dryness, trouble concentrating, and infertility.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the patient's ability to conceive or nurse offspring and/or their current reproductive status.

DataElementConcept.origin: ECOG CRF:Eastern Cooperative Oncology Group Case Report Form

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The preferred Value Domain to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.administrativeNotes: 2022.12.28 Alt VM added per ticket request CADSR0001837. aj

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Conceptual domain that includes value meanings to be used for Indicator Value Meanings such as Yes, No, Unknown, No Applicable

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A caDSR representation term that is used to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no

Concepts.definition: A response or indicator that can have a value of either yes or no.

RepresentationTerm.changeDescription: 10.3.20 TL changed WFS from RETIRED PHASED OUT to RETIRED ARCHIVED. Changed Workflow Status DBW 04-27-2016

ReferenceDocuments.name: Is the patient a pre- or peri
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is the patient a pre- or peri- menopausal woman?

ReferenceDocuments.name: NRG CRF_Text2
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is the patient premenopausal with greater than or equal to 12 months of amenorrhea and FSH and LH levels in premenopausal range?

ReferenceDocuments.name: NRG CRF_Text1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is the patient premenopausal with ≥ 12 months of amenorrhea and FSH and LH levels in premenopausal range?

ReferenceDocuments.name: NRG CRF Text 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is the patient premenopausal (evidence of functioning ovaries) at the time of pre-entry?
